title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A classic novel about teenage rebellion and alienation.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism, surveillance, and mind control.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that explores the issues of class, marriage, and social expectations.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of wealth, excess, and the American Dream during the Jazz Age.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge between a sailor and a giant white whale.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian science fiction novel about a future where humanity is controlled through pleasure and conditioning.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A prelude to the Lord of the Rings trilogy, detailing the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel set during the Napoleonic Wars, exploring the lives of Russian aristocracy.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological exploration of guilt, morality, and redemption.
